000040.SZ.summary: Tunghsu Azure Renewable Energy Co.,Ltd. provides energy services in China. It operates photovoltaic and wind power stations; and provides smart energy services and clean energy materials, as well as offers ecological management, water environment restoration and operation, soil and mine restoration, and hazardous and solid waste treatment services. The company was formerly known as Baoan Hongji Real Estate Group Co., Ltd. and changed its name to Tunghsu Azure Renewable Energy Co.,Ltd. in July 2016. Tunghsu Azure Renewable Energy Co.,Ltd. was founded in 1950 and is based in Shenzhen, China.

000791.SZ.summary: GEPIC Energy Development Co., Ltd. invests in and develops new energy and hydroelectric renewable energy projects in China. The company also engages in the high-tech research and development; and provision of production and operation related information consulting services. It operates a hydropower plant with a total installed capacity of 1,476,700 kilowatts; a wind power plant with a total installed capacity of 803,500 kilowatts; and a photovoltaic plant with a total installed capacity of 8.6 million kilowatts. The company was formerly known as Northwest Yongxin Chemical Industry Co., Ltd. and changed its name to GEPIC Energy Development Co., Ltd. in December 2012. GEPIC Energy Development Co., Ltd. was founded in 1997 and is based in Lanzhou, China.

000993.SZ.long_name: Fujian Mindong Electric Power Limited Company
000993.SZ.summary: Fujian Mindong Electric Power Limited Company generates hydroelectric and wind power in China. It is also involved in the real estate development, hotel operation, finance, shipping, mining, tourism, trade, distribution, power maintenance, and lithium battery businesses. The company was founded in 1998 and is based in Ningde, China.

002608.SZ.summary: Jiangsu Guoxin Corp. Ltd. provides thermal power and fiduciary services in China. The company engages in the electricity and thermal production, and relevant electricity services. It also provides financial trust services. The company was formerly known as Sainty Marine Corporation Ltd. and changed its name to Jiangsu Guoxin Corp. Ltd. in March 2017. Jiangsu Guoxin Corp. Ltd. was founded in 2003 and is based in Nanjing, China.

0090.HK.summary: Puxing Energy Limited develops, operates, and manages natural gas-fired power plants in Zhejiang province. It owns four natural gas-fired power plants with a total installed capacity of approximately 458MW, which include 457MW natural gas power generation and 578kW photovoltaic power generation scale; and a heating capacity of approximately 160 tonnes per hour. The company was formerly known as Puxing Clean Energy Limited and changed its name to Puxing Energy Limited in June 2020. The company was incorporated in 2008 and is headquartered in Hangzhou, the People's Republic of China.

0579.HK.long_name: Beijing Jingneng Clean Energy Co., Limited
0579.HK.summary: Beijing Jingneng Clean Energy Co., Limited generates gas-fired power and heat energy, wind power, photovoltaic power, and hydropower in the People's Republic of China. As of December 31, 2019, the company had an installed capacity of 9,622 megawatt (MW), including seven gas-fired power cogeneration plants with 4,702 MW; wind power generation capacity of 2,398 MW; photovoltaic power generation installed capacity of 2,071 MW; and hydropower installed capacity of 450 MW. The company sells electricity to local grid companies. It also offers repair and maintenance; investment management; and finance leasing services. The company was formerly known as Beijing Jingneng Energy Technology Investment Co., Ltd. and changed its name to Beijing Jingneng Clean Energy Co., Limited in August 2010. Beijing Jingneng Clean Energy Co., Limited was founded in 2010 and is based in Beijing, the People' Republic of China. Beijing Jingneng Clean Energy Co., Limited is a subsidiary of Beijing Energy Holding Co., Ltd.

0916.HK.long_name: China Longyuan Power Group Corporation Limited
0916.HK.summary: China Longyuan Power Group Corporation Limited generates and sells wind and coal power in the People's Republic of China. It operates in two segments, Wind Power and Coal Power. The company designs, develops, constructs, manages, and operates wind and coal power plants. It also operates other power projects, such as thermal, solar, tidal, biomass, and geothermal solar power. In addition, the company is involved in the coal trading business. Further, it manufactures and sells power equipment, as well as provides consulting, maintenance, and training services to wind and other renewable power generation plants. The company was formerly known as China Longyuan Electric Power Group Corporation and changed its name to China Longyuan Power Group Corporation Limited in July 2009. China Longyuan Power Group Corporation Limited was founded in 1993 and is headquartered in Beijing, the People's Republic of China. China Longyuan Power Group Corporation Limited is a subsidiary of China Energy Investment Corporation Limited.

1798.HK.long_name: China Datang Corporation Renewable Power Co., Limited
1798.HK.summary: China Datang Corporation Renewable Power Co., Limited, together with its subsidiaries, generates and sells wind power and other renewable power in the People's Republic of China. The company develops, invests in, constructs, and manages wind power and other renewable energy sources, including solar power and biomass. It also engages in the research and development, application, and promotion of low carbon technology; research, sale, testing, and maintenance of renewable energy-related equipment; power generation; and design, construction and installation, repair, and maintenance of domestic and international power projects. In addition, the company provides import and export services for renewable energy equipment and technologies; foreign investments; and renewable energy-related consulting services. As of December 31, 2019, it had consolidated installed capacity of 9,961 megawatts. The company was formerly known as Datang Chifeng Saihanba Wind Power Generation Co., Ltd. and changed its name to China Datang Corporation Renewable Power Co., Limited in March 2009. The company was founded in 2004 and is headquartered in Beijing, the People's Republic of China. China Datang Corporation Renewable Power Co., Limited is a subsidiary of China Datang Corporation Ltd.

3868.HK.summary: Xinyi Energy Holdings Limited, an investment holding company, owns, operates, and manages solar farms in the People's Republic of China. The company operates approximately 15 solar farms with an installed capacity of 1,494 megawatts. It sells electricity to the State grid companies. The company was incorporated in 2015 and is based in Wuhu, the People's Republic of China. Xinyi Energy Holdings Limited is a subsidiary of Xinyi Solar Holdings Limited.

600025.SS.summary: Huaneng Lancang River Hydropower Inc. invests, develops, constructs, operates, and manages hydropower projects in China. The company was founded in 2001 and is based in Kunming, China.

600116.SS.long_name: Chongqing Three Gorges Water Conservancy and Electric Power Co., Ltd.
600116.SS.summary: Chongqing Three Gorges Water Conservancy and Electric Power Co., Ltd., together with its subsidiaries, primarily engages in the power generation and supply business in China. It owns hydropower stations with an installed capacity of 750,000 kW; and operates 9 110KV substations and 19 35KV substations with total capacity of 1137.05MVA. The company is also involved in the electrical and mechanical equipment installation, maintenance, and commissioning activities. In addition, it operates as an electrical engineering, and urban and road lighting engineering contractor; and constructs water conservancy and hydropower projects. Further, it offers heating and power supply related services. Chongqing Three Gorges Water Conservancy and Electric Power Co., Ltd. was founded in 1929 and is headquartered in Chongqing, China.

600290.SS.summary: Huayi Electric Company Limited primarily operates in the electric equipment industry in China and internationally. It produces wind turbine generator systems; outdoor circuit breakers, automatic circuit sectionalizers and reclosers, outdoor load break switches, outdoor disconnect switches, and power transformers; MV and LV switchgears and compact substations; medium voltage switches; low voltage apparatus; meters and relays; current and potential transformers; and power lines and accessories. The company also engages in the measurement and evaluation of wind resources; constructing and operating wind farm projects; and provision of technical advisory services on wind farm construction and operations. In addition, it is involved in the sewage treatment and ecological remediation of contaminated soil, atmospheric environment, solid waste disposal, and ecological engineering and environmental businesses, as well as operates as a small loan company. The company is headquartered in Yueqing, China. Huayi Electric Company Limited is a subsidiary of Huayi Group. Co., Ltd.

600310.SS.long_name: Guangxi Guidong Electric Power Co., LTD.
600310.SS.summary: Guangxi Guidong Electric Power Co., LTD., together with its subsidiaries, engages in the supply of electric power in China. It is also involved in securities, oil trading, and other activities. As of December 31, 2018, the company had an installed capacity of 377,600 kilowatts. The company was founded in 1998 and is based in Hezhou, China. Guangxi Guidong Electric Power Co., LTD. is a subsidiary of Guangxi Zhengrun Development Group Co., Ltd.

600868.SS.long_name: Guangdong Meiyan Jixiang Hydropower Co., Ltd.
600868.SS.summary: Guangdong Meiyan Jixiang Hydropower Co., Ltd. generates hydroelectric power in China. The company operates six hydropower stations with an installed capacity of 151,000 kilowatts. It also offers education services, as well as cement. The company was founded in 1993 and is based in Meizhou, China.

601016.SS.summary: CECEP Wind-power Corporation Co.,Ltd. develops, invests in, manages, constructs, operates, and maintains wind power projects primarily in China. It owns and operates wind power projects with total installed and under construction capacity of approximately 1900 megawatts. CECEP Wind-power Corporation Co.,Ltd. was founded in 2006 and is based in Beijing, China.

601619.SS.summary: Ningxia Jiaze Renewables Corporation Limited invests in, constructs, develops, operates, and manages energy projects. It operates wind power, photovoltaic, solar power, and micro-grid projects. The company was formerly known as Ningxia Jiaze Power Generation Co., Ltd. and changed its name to Ningxia Jiaze Renewables Corporation Limited in August 2015. Ningxia Jiaze Renewables Corporation Limited was founded in 2010 and is headquartered in Yinchuan, China.

6WX.F.long_name: China Longyuan Power Group Corporation Limited
6WX.F.summary: China Longyuan Power Group Corporation Limited generates and sells wind and coal power in the People's Republic of China. It operates in two segments, Wind Power and Coal Power. The company designs, develops, constructs, manages, and operates wind and coal power plants. It also operates other power projects, such as thermal, solar, tidal, biomass, and geothermal solar power. In addition, the company is involved in the coal trading business. Further, it manufactures and sells power equipment, as well as provides consulting, maintenance, and training services to wind and other renewable power generation plants. The company was formerly known as China Longyuan Electric Power Group Corporation and changed its name to China Longyuan Power Group Corporation Limited in July 2009. China Longyuan Power Group Corporation Limited was founded in 1993 and is headquartered in Beijing, the People's Republic of China. China Longyuan Power Group Corporation Limited is a subsidiary of China Energy Investment Corporation Limited.

9AE.F.summary: Puxing Energy Limited develops, operates, and manages natural gas-fired power plants in Zhejiang province. It owns four natural gas-fired power plants with a total installed capacity of approximately 458MW, which include 457MW natural gas power generation and 578kW photovoltaic power generation scale; and a heating capacity of approximately 160 tonnes per hour. The company was formerly known as Puxing Clean Energy Limited and changed its name to Puxing Energy Limited in June 2020. The company was incorporated in 2008 and is headquartered in Hangzhou, the People's Republic of China.

BJ6.F.long_name: Beijing Jingneng Clean Energy Co., Limited
BJ6.F.summary: Beijing Jingneng Clean Energy Co., Limited generates gas-fired power and heat energy, wind power, photovoltaic power, and hydropower in the People's Republic of China. As of December 31, 2019, the company had an installed capacity of 9,622 megawatt (MW), including seven gas-fired power cogeneration plants with 4,702 MW; wind power generation capacity of 2,398 MW; photovoltaic power generation installed capacity of 2,071 MW; and hydropower installed capacity of 450 MW. The company sells electricity to local grid companies. It also offers repair and maintenance; investment management; and finance leasing services. The company was formerly known as Beijing Jingneng Energy Technology Investment Co., Ltd. and changed its name to Beijing Jingneng Clean Energy Co., Limited in August 2010. Beijing Jingneng Clean Energy Co., Limited was founded in 2010 and is based in Beijing, the People' Republic of China. Beijing Jingneng Clean Energy Co., Limited is a subsidiary of Beijing Energy Holding Co., Ltd.

BWM.SI.long_name: Zheneng Jinjiang Environment Holding Company Limited
BWM.SI.summary: Zheneng Jinjiang Environment Holding Company Limited plans, develops, constructs, operats, and manages waste-to-energy (WTE) facilities and energy management contracting (EMC) projects in the People's Republic of China, India, and internationally. The company operates through Waste-To-Energy Project Construction and Operation; and Project Technical and Management Service, Equipment Selection, and EMC Business segments. It generates and sells electricity and steam. The company also provides waste treatment services; project management, technical consulting and advisory, equipment selection, and EMC services; and construction services under service concession arrangement. In addition, it operates a thermal power plants. As of December 31, 2019, it operated 21 WTE facilities and four resource recycling projects in 13 provinces, autonomous regions, and centrally-administered municipalities in China with a total waste treatment capacity of 30,380 tons/day and an installed electricity power generation capacity of 632 MW. The company was formerly known as China Jinjiang Environment Holding Company Limited and changed its name to Zheneng Jinjiang Environment Holding Company Limited in November 2019. Zheneng Jinjiang Environment Holding Company Limited was founded in 1998 and is based in Hangzhou, the People's Republic of China.

CLPXF.long_name: China Longyuan Power Group Corporation Limited
CLPXF.summary: China Longyuan Power Group Corporation Limited generates and sells wind and coal power in the People's Republic of China. It operates in two segments, Wind Power and Coal Power. The company designs, develops, constructs, manages, and operates wind and coal power plants. It also operates other power projects, such as thermal, solar, tidal, biomass, and geothermal solar power. In addition, the company is involved in the coal trading business. Further, it manufactures and sells power equipment, as well as provides consulting, maintenance, and training services to wind and other renewable power generation plants. The company was formerly known as China Longyuan Electric Power Group Corporation and changed its name to China Longyuan Power Group Corporation Limited in July 2009. China Longyuan Power Group Corporation Limited was founded in 1993 and is headquartered in Beijing, the People's Republic of China. China Longyuan Power Group Corporation Limited is a subsidiary of China Energy Investment Corporation Limited.

CLPXY.long_name: China Longyuan Power Group Corporation Limited
CLPXY.summary: China Longyuan Power Group Corporation Limited generates and sells wind and coal power in the People's Republic of China. It operates in two segments, Wind Power and Coal Power. The company designs, develops, constructs, manages, and operates wind and coal power plants. It also operates other power projects, such as thermal, solar, tidal, biomass, and geothermal solar power. In addition, the company is involved in the coal trading business. Further, it manufactures and sells power equipment, as well as provides consulting, maintenance, and training services to wind and other renewable power generation plants. The company was formerly known as China Longyuan Electric Power Group Corporation and changed its name to China Longyuan Power Group Corporation Limited in July 2009. China Longyuan Power Group Corporation Limited was founded in 1993 and is headquartered in Beijing, the People's Republic of China. China Longyuan Power Group Corporation Limited is a subsidiary of China Energy Investment Corporation Limited.

CREG.summary: China Recycling Energy Corporation engages in the recycling energy business in China. The company designs, finances, constructs, installs, operates, and transfers waste energy recycling projects to mid- to large-size enterprises involved in high energy-consuming businesses. It provides waste pressure-to-energy solutions, including the Blast Furnace Top Gas Recovery Turbine Unit, a system that utilizes high pressure gas emitted from the blast furnace top to drive turbine units and generate electricity; and waste heat-to-energy solutions, such as heat power generation projects for applications in cement, steel, coking coal, and nonferrous metal industries, which collect the residual heat from various manufacturing processes. The company also offers waste gas-to-energy solutions comprising the Waste Gas Power Generation system that utilizes flammable waste gas from coal mining, petroleum exploitation, refinery processing, or other sources as a fuel source to generate electricity; and the Combined Cycle Power Plant, which employs power generating cycle to utilize the waste gas that generates electricity by burning the flammable waste gas in a gas turbine, as well as uses the waste heat from burning the gas to make steam to generate additional electricity through a steam turbine. In addition, it provides project investment, investment management, economic information consulting, technical, financial leasing, and financial leasing transactions consulting services; sells and leases energy saving systems and equipment; and purchases, repairs, and disposes financial leasing assets. The company was formerly known as China Digital Wireless, Inc. and changed its name to China Recycling Energy Corporation in March 2007. China Recycling Energy Corporation was incorporated in 1980 and is headquartered in Xi'an, China.

DT7.F.long_name: China Datang Corporation Renewable Power Co., Limited
DT7.F.summary: China Datang Corporation Renewable Power Co., Limited, together with its subsidiaries, generates and sells wind power and other renewable power in the People's Republic of China. The company develops, invests in, constructs, and manages wind power and other renewable energy sources, including solar power and biomass. It also engages in the research and development, application, and promotion of low carbon technology; research, sale, testing, and maintenance of renewable energy-related equipment; power generation; and design, construction and installation, repair, and maintenance of domestic and international power projects. In addition, the company provides import and export services for renewable energy equipment and technologies; foreign investments; and renewable energy-related consulting services. As of December 31, 2019, it had consolidated installed capacity of 9,961 megawatts. The company was formerly known as Datang Chifeng Saihanba Wind Power Generation Co., Ltd. and changed its name to China Datang Corporation Renewable Power Co., Limited in March 2009. The company was founded in 2004 and is headquartered in Beijing, the People's Republic of China. China Datang Corporation Renewable Power Co., Limited is a subsidiary of China Datang Corporation Ltd.

FEWP.summary: Far East Wind Power Corp., a development stage company, focuses on the development, construction, and operation of utility-scale wind energy projects primarily in the People's Republic of China. The company was formerly known as Celestial Delights USA Corp. and changed its name to Far East Wind Power Corp. in February 2010. Far East Wind Power Corp. was founded in 2008 and is based in Beijing, the People's Republic of China.
